abstract: The major record companies on Thursday settled a copyright infringement lawsuit with LimeWire, a popular file-sharing network, according to a person with knowledge of the negotiations.
snippet: The major record companies on Thursday settled a copyright infringement lawsuit with LimeWire, a popular file-sharing network, according to a person with knowledge of the negotiations.
lead_paragraph: 8:15 p.m. | Updated Ending a five-year court battle over music piracy, the major record companies on Thursday settled a copyright infringement lawsuit with LimeWire, a popular file-sharing network, for $105 million, the Recording Industry Association of America announced.

headline.main: Major Record Labels Settle Suit With LimeWire
